[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Overall architecture] [Audit logging] Are all remote execution requests logged with sufficient detail to trace malicious activity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Overall architecture] [Rate limiting per peer] Can a single compromised remote executor flood others with messages to cause targeted DoS? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Overall architecture] [Execution isolation] If a malicious NetworkMessage causes a handler to panic, is it isolated or can it crash the entire node? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Protocol design] [Lack of versioning] NetworkMessage has no version field - can protocol upgrades cause incompatibility between nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Protocol design] [No checksum] Without checksums in NetworkMessage, can bit flips during transmission cause silent corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Protocol design] [Missing timestamp] No timestamp field means messages can be delayed indefinitely - can this cause time-of-check-time-of-use bugs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Protocol design] [No priority field] All messages treated equally - can low-priority messages block critical consensus messages? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Protocol design] [Unbounded string] message_type is unbounded String - can extremely long strings cause memory exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Protocol design] [No fragmentation support] Large messages must fit in single NetworkMessage - can this cause inefficient transmission or failures? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Rust safety] [Prost unsafe code] Does prost-generated code contain any unsafe blocks that could cause memory corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Rust safety] [Clone derive] NetworkMessage derives Clone - can deep cloning large messages cause performance issues or stack overflow? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Rust safety] [Vec allocation] Can message Vec<u8> allocation fail on low-memory systems, and is failure handled gracefully? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs] [Rust safety] [String UTF-8 validity] Is message_type validated as valid UTF-8, or can invalid strings cause panics downstream? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.serde.rs] [Rust safety] [BytesDeserialize] Can BytesDeserialize wrapper cause type confusion when deserializing malformed base64? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.tonic.rs] [Rust safety] [Arc reference cycles] Can improper Arc usage create reference cycles causing memory leaks in long-running services? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.tonic.rs] [Rust safety] [Send/Sync bounds] Are T: Send + Sync bounds sufficient to guarantee thread safety for all service implementations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Concurrency] [Handler map race] Can concurrent access to inbound_handlers HashMap cause data races despite Mutex protection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Concurrency] [Channel send race] Can concurrent sends to same channel from multiple threads cause message reordering? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Concurrency] [Async/sync boundary] Can deadlocks occur at the boundary between tokio async runtime and rayon thread pools? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Concurrency] [Server startup race] Can multiple threads calling start() simultaneously create race conditions in server initialization? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.remote_executor.v1.rs + secure/net] [Concurrency] [Shutdown coordination] During shutdown, can in-flight messages be lost if handlers are removed while messages are being processed? (High)
